org.sd.cluster.io
Class NodeServer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      org.sd.cluster.io.NodeServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, NodeServerMXBean
public class NodeServer
extends java.lang.Thread
implements NodeServerMXBean

Node server.

Multithreaded management of sockets and incoming messages from a NodeClient over a port.

Starts the server thread to fill the queue and message handler threads by polling the message queue.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

NodeServer

public NodeServer(Context context,
                  java.net.InetSocketAddress mySocketAddress,
                  int numSocketThreads,
                  int numMessageHandlerThreads)
Construct a node server.

Parameters:
context - The context for this server.
mySocketAddress - The server's socket address for receiving connections.
numSocketThreads - Number of threads to pool for managing sockets.
numMessageHandlerThreads - Number of threads to handle messages.

reset

public void reset(int numSocketThreads,
                  int numMessageHandlerThreads,
                  boolean resetStats)
Reset this server with the given numbers of threads.

Specified by:
reset in interface NodeServerMXBean
Parameters:
numSocketThreads - The new number of threads for listening on sockets (leave unchanged if <= 0).
numMessageHandlerThreads - The new number of message handler threads (leave unchanged if <= 0).
resetStats - If true, then the stats will all be reset.

pauseHandling

public void pauseHandling()
Pause handling messages, but keep accepting and responding to them.

Note that the message queue will fill with uncoming requests while paused.

Specified by:
pauseHandling in interface NodeServerMXBean

Resume handling messages from the queue.

getServerTimeStats

public StatsAccumulator getServerTimeStats()
Get the overall stats for the time, in millis, to service requests.

This is the sum of receive, responseGen, and send time stats and does not include handle time stats.

NOTE: Time is measured from the reception of a request to the sending of a response.

Specified by:
getServerTimeStats in interface NodeServerMXBean

shutdown

public void shutdown(boolean now)
Shutdown this node server.

Note that the node server will not be able to come back up after being shutdown.

Parameters:
now - If true, then performa a more aggressive shutdown, not necessarily waiting for threads to die nicely.
